main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were reported in Alamogordo, New Mexico, notably on October 6 and October 16, 1957.
interesting points: The first sighting on October 6, 1957, involved a bright, fast-moving object making abrupt turns, observed for 20-25 minutes by a lab technician., Observations included descriptions of the objects as single, white, bright, round, and steady., The Aerial Phenomena Research Organization claimed to have authentic photographs of a saucer-shaped object 4,000 feet in diameter., Reports indicated geological disturbances and radioactive contamination in the area where the sightings occurred., Dr. Carl Jung commented on the psychological aspects of UFO sightings, suggesting that they reflect real phenomena.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects, including saucer-shaped and bright objects
witness description: lab technician and local officials, including Dr. Carl Jung
